DOC.brief_summary: The intent of this study is to evaluate the clinical performance of an experimental dental bonding agent for use with dental restorative composites with and without pretreatment of the tooth dentin and enamel using phosphoric acid etching.
DOC.brief_title: Comparative Study of Experimental Dental Adhesive With and Without Phosphoric Acid Pretreatment
DOC.detailed_description: The intent of this study is to evaluate the clinical performance of an experimental dental bonding agent (adhesive) for use with dental restorative composites with and without pretreatment of the tooth dentin and enamel using phosphoric acid etching.
DOC.criteria: Patients in need of Class I and Class II restorations in premolars and molars. Patients with fewer than 20 teeth Patients exhibiting poor oral hygiene or uncontrolled periodontal disease Pregnant women or lactating mothers Patients with known allergies to HEMA or resinbased materials Patients with medical conditions that would contraindicate dental treatment Patients with xerostomia
